page.title: 12Fire Services in Skegness
page.content: {The Old Fire Station :}two fire engines were kept in what is now the furniture shop. A third engine was kept on Richmond Drive in the Coop garage. When there was a fire a call boy would run to the railway station where there was a fire bell. The boy would ring the bell to tell the men that the horses were required to pull the fire engine. The horses were kept in a field on Richmond Drive. The Fire Station was built onto the Town Hall. There were 10 full time and ten part time firemen.In the {modern fire {station (1973)}the fire engines are kept in a garage next to the station. Radio alarms called alerters summon the fire men to the engines. There is a lot of paper work for the firemen to do. Firemen also do fire checks on guest houses and hotels. They have 4 engines and 2 special alert engines.
